content: total knockout afghan materials yarn any yarn will work i used medium/dk weight for my example blanket crochet hook any hook will work i used a i hook for my example blanket 5 5 mm scissors stitch markers crochet stitches needed chain chain stitch st skip skip single_crochet stitch single_crochet video tutorial here step by step photo tutorial here half_double_crochet stitch half_double_crochet video tutorial here step by step photo tutorial here double_crochet stitch double_crochet video tutorial here step by step photo tutorial here triple interlocking block stitch video tutorial here step by step photo tutorial here total knockout afghan pattern make chains in the multiple of 3 + 2 i made 155 chs for my example blanket row 1 make 1 double_crochet into the 3rd chain from your hook make 1 double_crochet into each of the next 2 chs *make 3 chs skip 3 chs make 1 double_crochet into each of the next 3 chs repeat from * for the rest of your row row 2 make 3 chs skip 3 sts *make 1 double_crochet into the chs under the next previous chain 3 space going forward you will work into the tops of double_crochet underneath make 3 chs skip 3 sts repeat from * until you have 1 block of 3 double_crochet + some chs left in your row make 3 chs skip 3 sts make 1 single_crochet into the tops of those previous chs at the end of this row row 3 make 3 chs *make 1 double_crochet into the tops of the double_crochet under the next previous chain 3 space make 3 chs skip 3 sts repeat from * for the rest of your row alternate between row 2 & 3 for however long you want your blanket last row to close open spaces chain 1 *1 single_crochet into each st 1 half_double_crochet into each open space/sts underneath repeat from * across blog post about this afghan on my
